original: Berninger, Anders, hovpredikant, kyrkoherde, Räpplinge, f. 16/2/92 i Södervidinge, Malmöh. L G. 18 m. Lilly Svensson. Barn: Nik-Gustaf f. 19, fänrik, Sven-Erik 21, lantbruks-stud., Ingemo 35. — Stud:ex. i Lund 14, teol. fil. ex. där 25, teol. kand. 26, prakt. teol. prov samt prästv. i. Växjö stift 27. Banktj :man 15-18, fondchef 19-21, vik. folkskoll. 22-24, v. pastor i Rogberga 27-28, i Repplinge 28, kj^rkoh. där sed. 28, tjg. e. o. hov-pred. sed. 44. Ordf. i kyrkostämma sed. 27, skolråd 27-40, led. av barnav:-nd sed. 28, led. av dir. f. Drottn. Victorias vilo-hem 30-37, komm:fuMm. 39- 42, v. ordf. i pens :nd sed. 40. LVO, H. M. Konungens GM åttonde storl m. Serafimerordens band, FMM.
translated:
Berninger, Anders, court preacher, parish priest of Räpplinge. Born on February 16th, 1892 in Södervidinge, Malmöhus. Married to Lilly Svensson in 1918. Children: Nik-Gustaf, born in 1919 and became a lieutenant, Sven-Erik, born in 1921 and studied agriculture, and Ingemo, born in 1904. 

He passed his final exams in Lund in 1914, received his theology degree in 1925, and became a candidate in theology in 1926. He passed his practical theology examination and was ordained as a priest in the diocese of Växjö in 1927. 

From 1915 to 1918, he worked in a bank and from 1919 to 1921, he was a fund manager. He worked as a substitute primary school teacher from 1922 to 1924 and then became an assistant pastor in Rogberga from 1927 to 1928. He then became the pastor of Räpplinge in 1928 and served there until 1944, also serving as the court preacher. 

He was the chairman of the church meeting from 1927 and served on the school board from 1927 to 1940. He was a member of the child welfare committee from 1928 and a member of the board of directors for Queen Victoria's Rest Home from 1930 to 1937. He was a member of the municipality committee from 1939 to 1942 and the vice chairman of the pension committee from 1940. 

He received the Litteris et Artibus medal and was awarded the 8th grade of the Order of the Sword by King Gustaf VI Adolf. He was also a member of the Order of Vasa.

memberOf.name: Queen Victoria's Rest Home Board of Directors
